intro: Daucus gingidium subsp. rupestris, commonly known as the rock carrot, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
